title: How to Make Math Symbols on Your Mac (OS X)

steps.title: Look for the following icon on the topmost menu bar with the Finder active:.
steps.content: Look for the following icon on the topmost menu bar with the Finder active:. Click on it and hold the mouse button down.

steps.title: Scroll down to "Show Emoji and Symbols".
steps.content: Scroll down to "Show Emoji and Symbols".

steps.title: Select the part of your document where you want the math symbol to be placed.
steps.content: Select the part of your document where you want the math symbol to be placed. Do this by positioning the cursor there with the mouse via insertion.

steps.title: Double-click on the math symbol you want in the Keyboard Viewer.
steps.content: Double-click on the math symbol you want in the Keyboard Viewer. For example, the "∞" symbol. You may want to select from the various font options available on the right. You can also use the "Add to Favorites" button. In the upper right, click on the Add to Favorites button.

steps.title: Click on the Favorites menu item.
steps.content: Click on the Favorites menu item. Double-click on the "∞" infinity icon key.

steps.title: Look for the following icon on the topmost menu bar with the Finder active:.
steps.content: Look for the following icon on the topmost menu bar with the Finder active:. Click on it and hold the mouse button down. Scroll down to "Show Keyboard Viewer".

steps.title: Choose from the special key options also available when holding the Option, Command.
steps.content: Choose from the special key options also available when holding the Option, Command. Control and Shift keys, and combinations thereof.

steps.title: Holding down the Shift and Option keys and selecting the k key, you can obtain the "" apple symbol icon key for example.
steps.content: Holding down the Shift and Option keys and selecting the k key, you can obtain the "" apple symbol icon key for example.

steps.title: Hold down the Option and p keys to obtain the "π" pi symbol icon key.
steps.content: Hold down the Option and p keys to obtain the "π" pi symbol icon key. Other keys that are available this way in option pairs are the + ±, = ≠, < ¯, > ˘, ? ¿, d ∂, f ƒ, w ∑, j ∆ ,key-pairs etc. Also of use is the Null set, {ø}, available from the o key and option or Shift+Option = Ø. The degrees symbol is useful in trigonometry, from the zero key and option: 0º, or 90º ... and for temperatures of course. Final Image:
